mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Thanks him for essay proposing an uniform orthography for Indian languages; wishes it could become commencement of uniform orthography for world; had not known of petition from Salem about duty on books; about four years ago attempted a repeal of that duty, without effect; last report of Senate on subject does not seem favorable.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1822 February 13, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to [John] Pickering, n.p.
